title: Semi Radradra stars as Fiji find their feet at Rugby World Cup to thrash Georgia
text:
• Wing scores two tries and makes three others in Higashiosaka • Fiji secure first win after defeats by Uruguay and Australia

Semi Radradra scored two of Fiji’s seven tries and made three others as the Pacific Islanders finally got a win on the board at the Rugby World Cup with a 45-10 victory over Georgia at a rain-drenched Hanazono Rugby Stadium.

Eddie Jones shows strong hand in England team selection for Argentina clash Read more

While their surprise loss to Uruguay after their opening defeat by Australia has all but put paid to their hopes of reaching the quarter-finals, Fiji are now in pole position to finish third in Pool D and qualify for the 2023 World Cup.

Radradra was at the heart of their best moves and the former Australia rugby league international grabbed a brace as well as helping set up scores for the centre Waisea Nayacalevu, the scrum-half Frank Lomani and his fellow wing Josua Tuisova.

Georgia fought hard throughout and got a try from their totemic flanker Mamuka Gorgodze but they tired towards the end as the Fiji flanker Semi Kunatani and lock Apisalome Ratuniyarawa crossed to inflate the scoreline.
description: Semi Radradra scored two of Fiji’s seven tries and made three others as the Pacific Islanders finally got a win on the board at the Rugby World Cup with a 45-10 victory over Georgia
